summary: This is a memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York documenting a suicide attempt by inmate Jeffrey Epstein (76318-054) in the Special Housing Unit. Correctional officers heard noise, found Epstein with a homemade rope around his neck, removed it, and performed chest compressions before he was removed from the unit.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who attempted to hang himself in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Wm Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cell mate who alerted staff to Epstein's suicide attempt by stating Epstein had tried to hang himself.

connections.description: They were cell mates in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center; Tartaglione alerted staff to Epstein's suicide attempt.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt in MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted to hang himself in his cell in the Special Housing Unit using an orange homemade rope. Correctional officers heard noise, found him, removed the rope, and performed chest compressions. He was breathing but unresponsive and was later removed from the unit.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
Special Housing Unit, M tier, Cell 124
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide by hanging in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The attempt occurred in the Special Housing Unit, M tier, Cell 124.
Epstein's cell mate, Wm Tartaglione, alerted correctional officers to the incident.
Epstein was found with an orange homemade rope around his neck, was breathing but unresponsive.
Staff removed the rope, performed chest compressions, and removed Epstein from the unit without further incident.
